ETYMOLOGY: Coined in Neo-Latin, combining Latin bini ('two by two') and ocularis ('of the eye').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun that refers to an object composed of two parts but is always treated as plural.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An optical instrument, composed of two similar telescopes mounted side-by-side, used for viewing distant objects with both eyes simultaneously.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种光学仪器，由两个并排安装的望远镜组成，用于双眼同时观测远处的物体，即双筒望远镜。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She brought her powerful binoculars to the safari to see the distant animals clearly.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她带着她那副强力的双筒望远镜去参加野生动物之旅，以便清楚地看到远处的动物。
